Overall, Friedrichstadt is a must-visit destination for anyone interested in history, architecture, and culture, and is sure to leave a lasting impression on all who visit.

Plön is a charming town located in Schleswig-Holstein, Germany, that is easily accessible by various modes of transportation. The town is renowned for its picturesque lakes and offers visitors the opportunity to explore several historic churches, towers, and palaces. Visitors can enjoy a range of outdoor activities, including hiking, sailing, and canoeing. The town also boasts a variety of dining options, including a steak and pizza restaurant and a lakeside hotel and restaurant. Accommodation is available at a youth hostel. Nearby cities such as Kiel and Lübeck are also worth visiting. Overall, Plön is an ideal tourist destination for those seeking a peaceful and scenic getaway.

Husum is a charming city located on the North Sea coast of Schleswig-Holstein, Germany. It offers a unique blend of city life, nature, and North Frisian tradition. The city has a population of 23,000 people and is famous for being the birthplace of Theodor Storm, a renowned poet. Husum has a rich history with storm floods, which led to the construction of the Husum port. Visitors can explore several museums, churches, and other sites, including swimming pools and events such as the Crocus flowering. The city also offers a variety of dining and drinking options, as well as accommodations ranging from camping sites to luxury hotels. Husum is an ideal destination for tourists looking to experience the beauty of the North Sea coast while immersing themselves in the local culture and history. Visitors can easily connect to their next destination from Husum.

Flensburg is a city in Schleswig-Holstein, Germany, with a population of 90,000 inhabitants. It is known for being a border town and the headquarters of the central registry for traffic offenses committed throughout Germany. The city has a strong Danish minority and a German majority, with a history of being bilingual or even trilingual. Many Danes come to Flensburg to buy goods, while people from Flensburg like to hop across the border to places like Sønderborg to sight-see or shop. The best way to get around the city centre is by walking.

Flensburg offers a variety of attractions for tourists, including museums, churches, historical buildings, spectator sports, ferry tours, and theaters. The Museumsberg Flensburg exhibits local history artifacts and art, while the Naturwissenschaftliches Museum is a science museum. The Schifffahrtsmuseum is dedicated to Flensburg's maritime history. Other museums include the interactive science museum Phänomenta and the Shipyard museum. There are also several churches to visit, such as the 15th-century Nikolai-Apotheke and the Naval Academy Mürwik.

Flensburg is also known for its shopping, with numerous shops along the pedestrian street Holm and major malls like Fördepark and Scandinavien Park. The city has budget-friendly dining options like Strandgut and Pizzateca da Tonis, as well as mid-range and splurge restaurants. Accommodations range from a hotel outside the city center to a hostel and a youth hostel.

For those interested in exploring nearby cities, Flensburg is conveniently located near Kiel, Lübeck, Hamburg, and Schleswig. Overall, Flensburg offers a unique blend of German and Danish culture, history, and entertainment, making it a great tourist destination.

Timmendorfer Strand is a charming town in Schleswig Holstein, Germany that offers a range of attractions and activities for tourists. Visitors can easily access the town by train or boat. The town is home to Timmendorfer Sealife and Vogelpark Niendorf, which are popular attractions for families. Additionally, the town hosts events like the German Beach Volleyball Championships and JazzBaltica, which draw crowds from all over. There are plenty of dining options available, ranging from budget-friendly to high-end. Accommodation options include Maritim Clubhotel, Maritim Seehotel Timmendorfer Strand, and Hotel Seeschlösschen, which offer comfortable and convenient stays for tourists. Overall, Timmendorfer Strand is a great destination for those looking for a relaxing and enjoyable vacation.

Lübbecke is a charming small town in North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany, nestled at the foot of the picturesque Wiehen Hills. The town boasts a mostly flat and rural landscape, with its southern quarters extending up the northern hillside of the ridge. Visitors can easily access Lübbecke by road or rail, and there are several notable attractions to explore, including the Gehrmker Hius, Renkhausen Manor House, and Barre Brewery Museum. The annual Blasheimer Markt fair is also a popular event that draws in many visitors. For those looking to stay in Lübbecke, there are several hotels to choose from, such as Hotel Borchard or The Rose. Nearby cities worth visiting include Osnabrück and Bielefeld. Overall, Lübbecke is a charming and peaceful tourist destination that offers a glimpse into rural German life and culture.

Clausthal-Zellerfeld is a picturesque town in Lower Saxony, Germany, known for winter activities and mountain biking during the rest of the year. The town has a rich mining history, and visitors can explore several museums and historic mining pits and buildings. The town also offers a small ski resort, hiking trails, and a cycle network for mountain bikers. Clausthal-Zellerfeld has a well-known university and a variety of dining options, ranging from budget to splurge, with local and traditional cuisine. The town has beautiful historic buildings, including the largest wooden church in Germany and a former mint converted into a glass-blower. Tourist information is available at the Dietzelhaus, and the town can be reached by plane, car, or train. Clausthal-Zellerfeld offers various accommodation options, including a budget campsite and a 4-star hotel. Nearby towns such as Wildemann and Bad Grund offer hiking trails, skiing, and historic sites to explore.

Wismar is a charming city located on the Baltic Sea coast in Mecklenburg-Western Pomerania, Germany. Its historic center is a UNESCO world cultural heritage site, and it has a rich history dating back to the middle ages as part of the Hanseatic League. Visitors can easily arrive by train or car and get around on foot, local bus services, or bike. The old town and harbor areas are easily explored on foot, and visitors can also take a guided city tour in a small electric bus or a harbor cruise. The town has several historical attractions, including the Wasserkunst, Rathaus, and market place, St. Nikolai, Heiligen-Geist-Kirche, St. Georgen, Marienkirchenturm, Wassertor, and Baumhaus. The Alter Schwede restaurant is recommended for good food and service. The Altstadt Hotel offers basic but comfortable rooms with free wifi and parking, and breakfast buffet included. The Tourist-Office Wismar provides information for visitors. The island of Poel is easily reachable from Wismar, and a long-distance cycle path connects the whole of Germany's Baltic coast. Travel options include taking the train south to provincial capital Schwerin or east to the commercial, industrial, and university town of Rostock. Overall, Wismar is a great tourist destination with plenty of historical and cultural attractions to explore.

Güstrow is a charming town in Mecklenburg, Germany, that is perfect for tourists looking for a peaceful and historic destination. The town is famous for its renaissance palace and well-preserved old town, which are must-visit attractions. Güstrow has a population of 29,000 people and is located 45 km south of Rostock, making it easily accessible by the Rostock S-Bahn and city buses run by OVG. Tourists can explore Güstrow Palace, Güstrow Cathedral, St. Mary's Church, the Townhall, and Dobbertin Abbey, which are all steeped in history and culture. The Nature and Environment Park is a popular destination for nature lovers, and there are various dining options, ranging from budget to splurge. Tourists can choose from two hotels for accommodation. Güstrow is also an excellent base for exploring nearby cities and towns such as Rostock, Schwerin, and Hamburg. Overall, Güstrow is a perfect destination for tourists looking for a peaceful and historic getaway.

Rostock, the largest city in the German state of Mecklenburg-Western Pomerania, is a popular tourist destination known for its Hanseatic heritage and Baltic Sea ferries. The city boasts Germany's largest port for cruise ships and offers good public transport, including a tramway system and buses. Visitors can enjoy attractions such as Warnemünde beach, St. Peter's Church, the zoo, and the Teapot. Rostock also offers entertainment options such as the Stadthalle for shows and music events, the KTV neighborhood for bars and cafes, and the city walls with guided tours available. The University of Rostock is one of the world's oldest universities. Shopping can be found in the Kröpeliner Straße district and souvenirs in Warnemünde. The city offers a range of budget, mid-range, and splurge dining options, as well as bars, pubs, and clubs. Accommodation options include hostels, mid-range hotels, and luxury hotels with a yacht harbor. Rostock is generally safe, but visitors should be aware of pickpockets and dangerous swimming conditions. Free WiFi is available in many areas of the city. Nearby destinations include Bad Doberan, Hamburg, and Rügen.

Bad Doberan is a spa town located on the Baltic coastline in Central Mecklenburg, Germany. It is known for its posh seaside resort, Heiligendamm, which is the oldest seaside spa in continental Europe. The town can be accessed by the Baltic Sea Autobahn A20 or the regional Wismar-Rostock line. Tourist attractions in Bad Doberan include the Doberan Minster, a steam-powered museum train that runs through the main street, and various dining options ranging from budget to splurge. Accommodation options include Hotel Prinzenpalais and the five-star Grand Hotel Heiligendamm. Nearby destinations include Güstrow, Rostock, Hamburg, Rügen, Schwerin, and Wismar. Overall, Bad Doberan is a great tourist destination for those looking to relax and enjoy the beautiful Baltic coastline.

Fehmarn is a popular tourist destination located in the southern Baltic Sea, belonging to Schleswig-Holstein, Germany. The island is mostly made up of farmland and has a population of 12,000. It is connected to mainland Germany by a road bridge and has a harbor with frequent ferries from Rødby in Denmark. The island is known for its beautiful birding spots and has several tourist attractions, including windmills, lighthouses, and a waterbird reserve. Fehmarn is also home to several border shops that sell consumer goods to tourists from Denmark and Sweden. The island is currently undergoing a major infrastructure project that will replace the aging bridge across Fehmarnsund and build a new tunnel under Fehmarnbelt for both motorcars and trains. This will make it easier for tourists to access the island. Overall, Fehmarn is a great destination for those looking to explore the natural beauty of the Baltic Sea and experience the unique culture of Schleswig-Holstein.

Tönning is a charming small town in Schleswig Holstein that offers a peaceful and relaxing vacation experience. The town boasts a beautiful beach with soft silt deposits that are believed to have healing properties for skin diseases. Visitors can enjoy cycling around the town and taking in the North Frisian small town flair and historic buildings. The town has good infrastructure and can be easily reached by train. Tourists interested in culture will find plenty to explore in Tönning, including popular sights like the Multimar Wattforum and St. Laurentius. For those looking for outdoor activities, the Eider Barrage is a great bike trip. The town also has a saltwater open-air pool and a few places to eat and sleep. Husum, a popular shopping destination, is just a short train ride away. Overall, Tönning is a great destination for those seeking a quieter vacation with plenty of opportunities for relaxation and exploration.

Neubrandenburg is a charming town situated in the Mecklenburg Lake District, boasting a well-preserved town wall and a stunning 13th-century Gothic-style church. Visitors can easily access the town by car or train, and there are even short flights available from the local airport. Accommodation options are plentiful, with Hotel Badehaus and Radisson Blu Hotel being popular choices. The town is surrounded by beautiful natural scenery, making it an ideal destination for outdoor enthusiasts. Nearby destinations such as Rostock and Szczecin offer additional opportunities for exploration. Overall, Neubrandenburg is a must-visit destination for those seeking a unique and picturesque vacation spot.

Büsum is a charming fishing and tourist town located on the North Sea coast in Schleswig Holstein, Germany. It is a popular summer vacation spot for families and day trips from Hamburg, known for its Büsumer Krabben. The town was once an island with three villages, but devastating floods destroyed most of it. Today, it is a small and easily navigable town that offers a range of attractions for visitors. 

Tourists can explore the Büsum Lighthouse, City Hall, Museum am Meer, Museumshafen Büsum, and St. Clemens church. The town is famous for its Krabben, which can be purchased directly off the boat. Visitors can stay in unique accommodations such as Schlafstrandkorb or hotels like Hotel Schelf and Küstenperle. Camping options are also available. 

Büsum offers a science museum called Phänomania and trips to the sea for pleasure or fishing. It is a good place to take children on a rainy day or to let out your inner child. The town was bombed during World War II but is now easily accessible by train, plane, and boat. Overall, Büsum is a charming and picturesque destination that offers a range of activities and attractions for tourists.

Kühlungsborn is a popular seaside resort on the Baltic coastline in Central Mecklenburg, attracting over 3 million overnight stays per year. The easiest way to get there is via the Baltic Sea Autobahn A20. Visitors can explore the area by the historical narrow-gauge railway Molli Spa Express or by foot or bike. The Baltic Sea watchtower and the Kühlungsborn Pier are popular attractions, while activities include the Bäderbahn Molli railway, Marina Kühlungsborn, and the beach. There are various accommodation options, including the Jugendgästehaus and Upstalsboom Hotelresidenz & SPA Kühlungsborn. Nearby destinations include Bad Doberan with Heiligendamm, Güstrow, Rostock, Hamburg, Rügen, Schwerin, Wismar, and Usedom. Overall, Kühlungsborn is a great tourist destination with plenty of things to see and do, making it a perfect spot for a relaxing vacation.

Stralsund is a picturesque city in Mecklenburg-Western Pomerania, Germany, with a Gothic historic center that is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Founded in 1234, the city was a member of the Hanseatic League and was part of the Swedish Empire from 1648 to 1814. Stralsund has good rail connections from major German cities and a local bus network. The city's attractions include the Church of St Mary's, Ozeaneum, and Gorch Fock I. The local brewery, Störtebeker, is also worth a visit. Accommodation options range from budget to splurge. Nearby destinations to visit include Greifswald, Rostock, Rügen and Hiddensee, Usedom Island, and Wismar. With its rich history and beautiful architecture, Stralsund is a must-visit destination for any traveler.

Sylt is a popular and expensive holiday destination in Germany, known for its 40-km white beach, dunes, and mudflats. The island is connected to the mainland by a railway-only causeway and has an airport and a year-round ferry. Visitors can get around by bus or bike, and there are four main cities, with Westerland being the main one. The island's main attractions include Denghoog, Rotes Kliff, Uwe Düne, and the Wandering Dunes of List. Sylt is a popular beach destination, with several segments of the beach designated as FKK (nudist). Visitors can rent a Strandkorb and hike along the beach or the paths in the dunes and heath behind the beach. The island is known for its seafood, with fish burgers being a popular takeaway specialty. There are budget, mid-range, and splurge dining options available, as well as various bars and clubs. Accommodations range from a youth hostel to hotels and a camping site. Visitors can also explore nearby destinations listed in the "Go next" section.

Anklam is a small town located in northeastern Mecklenburg Vorpommern, which is famous for being the birthplace of aviation pioneer Otto Lilienthal. Tourists can visit the Otto Lilienthal Museum and explore other historical sites such as Steintor, Marienkirche, and Nikolaikirche. Anklam remains a popular tourist destination for those interested in history and aviation. Visitors can also enjoy the beautiful architecture and scenic surroundings.

Rügen Island is Germany's largest island located on the southern Baltic Sea Coast in Mecklenburg-Western Pomerania. It is a popular holiday destination known for its sandy beaches, chalk cliffs, and resort architecture. The island has several towns and villages, including Bergen, Putbus, and Sassnitz, and popular bathing resorts like Binz and Sellin. Other destinations include Jasmund National Park, Prora, Kap Arkona, and Hiddensee. The island has 574 km of coastline with excellent beaches and nudist and dog beaches. Visitors can enjoy various activities such as riding, hot air balloon trips, diving, biking, water skiing, and golf. The island is known for its fresh seafood and asparagus during the season, and local sea-buckthorn fruit juice and Störtebeker beer are popular drinks. Accommodation options include holiday apartments, hotels, and hostels. Visitors should be cautious near the cliffs and wild boar. The island can be accessed by plane, car, train, and boat, and transportation options include bus and steam-powered narrow gauge railway. Wetland bird watching is a popular activity, and nearby attractions include Stralsund, Usedom Island, and Greifswald.

Bergen auf Rügen is the largest town and administrative center of Rügen, located in the middle of Germany's biggest island on the Baltic Sea coast. With a population of over 13,000, it offers visitors a hilly terrain with the Rugard woods reaching a height of 91 m above sea level. The town can be accessed by train from major German stations or by car via major roads on the island. Visitors can see the Marienkirche, the oldest surviving brick building in Mecklenburg-Western Pomerania, and the Ernst-Moritz-Arndt-Turm, the highest elevation in the central region of Rügen. Activities include forest climbing and summer rodeling. The town has a Real supermarket and restaurants such as Restaurant Kontor and Tüffelhus. Accommodation options include Parkhotel Rügen and Ratskeller. Nearby destinations include Binz, Breege-Juliusruh, and Stralsund. Overall, Bergen auf Rügen is a great tourist destination for those looking to explore the natural beauty and historical landmarks of Germany's largest island.

Greifswald is a historic town in Germany with a population of 59,000. It was a part of the Hanseatic League and has a university founded in 1456. The town suffered economic decline during the Soviet and East German era but has since received investment to improve the situation. The easiest way to get to Greifswald is by car, but there are also options for air, train, boat, bus, and bike transportation. The town center is small and best explored on foot or by bike. Visitors can see St. Nikolai cathedral, the town hall, and the Pommersches Landesmuseum, as well as attend recurring events throughout the year. There are various shopping options, including a shopping mall and small shops on Lange Strasse. There are budget, mid-range, and splurge options for eating out, and a pub called Zum alten Fritz serves local beer and light meals. Accommodation options include the Europa Hotel, Hôtel Galerie, Das Sofa, Mercure Hotel Greifswald Am Gorzberg, VCH Hotel Greifswald, and Alter Speicher. Nearby attractions include the fishing village Wieck, the ruin of the monastery of Eldena, Peenemünde, and Stralsund.

Sagard is a small town located on the island of Rügen, with a population of 2,500 people. It is an ideal place to stop on a journey or use as a base for exploring other parts of the island. The town's old center is being revitalized, with a mix of renovated and new businesses and houses. Sagard has a rich history, including a Slavic burgwall from the 12th century and a former health resort. Visitors can see the Dobberworth tumulus and dine at Villa Italia. The town is located on the B96 between Bergen auf Rügen and Sassnitz, with supermarkets on the edge of town towards Glowe. Sagard is a great tourist destination for those who want to explore the island's history and culture. The town offers a variety of activities, including sightseeing, dining, and shopping. Visitors can also enjoy the town's natural beauty, with its stunning landscapes and scenic views. Sagard is a must-visit destination for anyone traveling to Rügen.

Prora is a unique tourist destination located on the German Baltic Sea island of Rügen. It was originally built by the Nazi-era worker's organization Kraft durch Freude as a massive beach resort hotel for 20,000 people, but it was never used for its intended purpose. During the East German era, it was used as a military base. In the 1990s, parts of it were opened as a museum, but most parts remained empty until they were developed into apartments, youth hostels, and event locations since 2005. The building complex is the main attraction, and visitors can explore it on foot, by car, or by bicycle. The Baltic Sea beach offers a range of recreational activities and sports, and there are several places to eat, drink, and sleep in the area. Prora is a fascinating destination for history buffs, architecture enthusiasts, and anyone looking for a unique vacation experience. With its rich history and stunning natural surroundings, it's a must-visit destination for anyone traveling to the Baltic Sea region.

Putbus is a charming town situated on the island of Rügen in Germany. It is easily accessible by train and offers several notable attractions for visitors to explore. The Church of Mary Magdalene, Schlosskirche Putbus, and the Clock Museum are some of the must-visit places in the town. The town also offers a range of dining options, including Italian food and coffee at Kleiner Luxus. Visitors can also choose to stay at the Putbus Parkhotel, which offers comfortable accommodation. The town is perfect for those looking for a peaceful and relaxing vacation. The beautiful architecture and scenic surroundings make it an ideal destination for nature lovers and history enthusiasts. The town's rich cultural heritage and friendly locals make it a must-visit destination in Germany. Overall, Putbus is a great place to visit for those looking for a unique and memorable vacation experience.

Sassnitz is a charming seaside resort town in Mecklenburg-Western Pomerania, Germany, that offers visitors a range of activities and attractions. The town is renowned for its historic port and U-boat museum, which is a must-visit for history buffs. Sassnitz is easily accessible by train, bus, or ferry, and visitors can explore other towns on the island of Rügen via frequent buses. The nearby Jasmund National Park is perfect for hiking and nature lovers. Accommodation options in Sassnitz include Kurhotel Sassnitz and Strandhotel Sassnitz, both of which offer comfortable stays. The town also boasts a variety of restaurants, including Zur Alten Bank and La Bella Vita, as well as a supermarket for shopping. For those looking to explore further afield, nearby attractions include the town of Binz and the Kap Arkona lighthouse museum. Overall, Sassnitz is a fantastic tourist destination that offers something for everyone.

Binz is a popular seaside resort in Germany that offers sandy beaches, resort architecture, and natural surroundings. It is easily accessible by train and has a steam-powered narrow gauge railway. Visitors can explore the Prora complex, Granitz Hunting Lodge, and sand sculptures. The beach is a major attraction, with sections for families, dogs, and nudists. There are plenty of restaurants and hotels in the area, including holiday apartments and a spa hotel. Nearby towns worth visiting include Sassnitz, Sellin, Göhren, and Putbus. Overall, Binz is a great tourist destination for those looking to relax by the beach, explore historic landmarks, and enjoy the natural beauty of the area.

Zinnowitz is a popular sea-bath resort town located on the sunny island of Usedom in Germany. It offers various transportation options, including a railway station and a long-distance bus stop, making it easily accessible from nearby towns and cities. The town boasts a pier, a neo-Gothic church, and a thermal bath, providing visitors with plenty of opportunities to relax and unwind. Additionally, tourists can enjoy theatre performances during the annual Vineta Festival. There are several restaurants and accommodation options available, including a sports school that offers affordable stays. Overall, Zinnowitz is a great destination for those looking to enjoy a seaside vacation with plenty of amenities and activities to choose from.

Heringsdorf is a popular seaside resort located on Usedom Island in Germany, which shares a border with the Polish city of Świnoujście. The resort is made up of three spa areas, namely Ahlbeck, Bansin, and Heringsdorf. The island is easily accessible by train, car, and plane, making it a convenient destination for tourists. Visitors can enjoy a range of activities, including strolling along Germany's longest pier, admiring the resort's unique architecture, and visiting Tropenzoo Bansin. There are also plenty of restaurants and bars in each area, as well as a wide selection of hotels and holiday rentals. Nearby destinations worth exploring include Greifswald, Miedzyzdroje, Rügen, Stralsund, and Świnoujście. Overall, Heringsdorf is an ideal tourist destination for those seeking a relaxing seaside getaway with plenty of attractions and amenities to enjoy.

Peenemünde, located on the island of Usedom in Germany, is a popular tourist destination known for its historical significance during World War II. It was the birthplace of the V-1 flying bomb and V-2 rocket, which were heavily bombed by Allied forces. Although not much of the factories remain, visitors can still see the power plant, some rockets, and a bunker. The town was also used as an East German military base, and there is a lot of East German military equipment on exhibit. 

Visitors can access Peenemünde by train or ferry, and there are several museums and hiking trails to explore. The Peenemünde Historical Technical Museum is a must-visit for history buffs, as it showcases the development of rocket technology and the role Peenemünde played in the war. The nearby Usedom Nature Park offers scenic hiking trails and bike paths, while the Peenemünde Beach is perfect for a relaxing day by the sea. 

Other notable attractions in Peenemünde include the Peenemünde Airfield, which was used for testing rockets during the war, and the Peenemünde Harbor, which offers boat tours and fishing trips. The town also hosts several events throughout the year, including a rocket festival and a Christmas market. Overall, Peenemünde is a fascinating destination for history enthusiasts and nature lovers alike.

Sellin is a popular seaside resort located on the island of Rügen, which is known for its unique pier and steep coast with beaches. Visitors can easily arrive at Sellin (Rügen) Ost railway station by train. The resort features resort architecture from the "Belle Epoque" era, an amber museum, the famous Sellin Pier, the Granitz Hunting Lodge, and a bronze sculpture called Kaysa. There are several accommodation options available, including Villa Celia and Selliner Hof. The Böhmisches Gasthaus is a recommended restaurant for tourists. Overall, Sellin is a great tourist destination that offers a variety of attractions and activities for visitors to enjoy.

Hermannsburg is a charming town in Lower Saxony, Germany, situated on the River Örtze in the Lüneburg Heath. It is accessible by small roads or bus from nearby railway stations. The town offers a range of activities for visitors, including exploring the Southern Heath on foot or by bike, canoeing the Örtze, and visiting local attractions such as the Lutter Mill and the Ludwig Harms Haus. There are also plenty of options for dining and accommodation in the area. Nearby towns worth visiting include Bergen and Munster. Overall, Hermannsburg is a great tourist destination for those looking to experience the natural beauty and cultural heritage of Lower Saxony.
